toc_entry.title: Wide Open Spaces
toc_entry.description: The Chihuahuan Desert is a place of extremes, where the visitor not only observes but participates in the struggle for life and death.

toc_entry.title: The Cowboys, the Indian, And the Computer That Fumbled
toc_entry.description: The most important new addition to the Dallas Cowboys is a veteran from the team’s early years —computer genius Salam Qureishi.

toc_entry.title: Requiem For A Roller Coaster
toc_entry.description: The state fair’s Comet: will it rust in peace?.

toc_entry.title: The Faulty Cure
toc_entry.description: Houston is famous for medical cures. But when British rock star Ronnie Lane came to town with a crippling disease and $1 million for research, all he got was crippling legal problems.

toc_entry.title: Ma Ferguson
toc_entry.subtitle: Texas Primer
toc_entry.description: She unmasked the Klan and worried about the role of women, but she listened more to her husband than to the suffragettes.

toc_entry.title: My Kind Of Town
toc_entry.description: An enticing portfolio of what makes Houston Houston.

toc_entry.title: Vote For Me, Por Favor. Now Let’s Eat
toc_entry.description: Mix election time, South Texas, and barbecue, and you get the pachanga circuit, where politics and barbecue are served with equal reverence.

toc_entry.title: I Think I’m Rich, Therefore I am
toc_entry.subtitle: Business
toc_entry.description: A new class of self-styled experts called prosperity consultants say they have the solution to Texas’ economic bust: the bad times are all in our heads.

toc_entry.title: The Anglo-Tex Connection
toc_entry.subtitle: Texana
toc_entry.description: A Dallasite enamored of British class gets her sesquicentennial wish —a Texas embassy in London.

toc_entry.title: Getting Even Gets Old
toc_entry.subtitle: Movies
toc_entry.description: Revenge has seldom been so incendiary, but Heartburn fails to ignite; Blue Velvet is for the brave; Club Paradise is for the jolly.

toc_entry.title: Midland S Bebop Bash
toc_entry.subtitle: Jazz
toc_entry.description: What’s remarkable about this exclusive jazz party isn’t just that it’s in Midland. The biggest surprise comes when the music starts.

toc_entry.title: Shopping
toc_entry.description: From goggles that let you see in the dark to voice changers that make you sound like Daffy Duck, the Counter Spy Store is stocked for the age of paranoia.

toc_entry.title: Post-Modern Times
toc_entry.description: Two gleaming office towers are going up face to face in downtown Austin. Now their marketing managers have to rent the town asunder.

toc_entry.title: Downtown
toc_entry.description: Bail bonding is one Texas business that’s recession proof.

toc_entry.title: Reporter
toc_entry.description: Fashion shifts at Farah; Dave Pelz’s putter problems; will the Dallas establishment’s mayoral candidate please stand up?.

toc_entry.title: The Quidnunc
toc_entry.description: Checking in with Corpus’ famous insurance writer; smelling celebrity flowers with Leonard Tharp; sharing some Jell-O with Dionne Warwick.

toc_entry.title: State Secrets
toc_entry.description: Are the Elissa's sails trimmed for good? the Chronicle finds a possible buyer close to home—very close; mashing the mass transit tax.
